decks.notes: The deck focuses on efficiently assembling and resolving the Doomsday combo, using cards like Dark Ritual and Lotus Petal to generate mana quickly. The goal is to manipulate the top of the library with cards like Brainstorm and Ponder, then use Doomsday to set up a win condition with cards like Thassa's Oracle. Protection is provided through cards like Force of Will and Daze, while disruption is provided by Thoughtseize and Fatal Push. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Psychic Frog provide additional card selection and value to help execute the combo smoothly.

This deck revolves around the combo of using Painter's Servant to change the colors of all cards to a single color, then using Grindstone to mill the opponent's entire library in one turn. The deck also uses Goblin Engineer and Welder to tutor for and recur key combo pieces, while utilizing disruptive spells like Pyroblast and Red Elemental Blast to protect the combo. Additionally, the deck includes mana acceleration with Ancient Tomb and City of Traitors, along with card draw and filtering with Vexing Bauble and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker.

The deck is focused on quickly milling through the library, utilizing cards like Balustrade Spy and Undercity Informer to put cards into the graveyard. This strategy is supported by cards like Thassa's Oracle and Dread Return, allowing the player to win the game by having no cards left in the library. The deck also includes protection in the form of Pact of Negation and disruptive elements like Cabal Therapy. Overall, the goal is to assemble the required pieces and execute the combo as efficiently as possible to secure victory.

This deck focuses on utilizing the synergy between creatures and spells to maintain board control and pressure the opponent. It aims to deploy aggressive threats early on while disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Swords to Plowshares and Thoughtseize. By utilizing cards like Stoneforge Mystic and Aether Vial, the deck can efficiently deploy key creatures and equipment to gain an advantage. The inclusion of Yorion as a companion allows for additional value and flexibility in longer games. Overall, the deck aims to quickly establish dominance on the battlefield and maintain pressure throughout the game.

The deck focuses on using Nadu, Winged Wisdom to combo off with Nomads en-Kor to draw cards and generate infinite mana. It also includes cards like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares for protection and removal. The deck aims to control the board while setting up its combo pieces and eventually win the game through card advantage and overwhelming the opponent with its combo. The deck utilizes cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath to provide additional value and utility to achieve its win condition.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana and cheating giant creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn into play using cards like Sneak Attack and Show and Tell. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and win the game before they have a chance to respond. The deck utilizes cards like Force of Will and Flusterstorm to protect its combo pieces and disrupt opponent's strategies. It also includes cards like Brainstorm and Ponder for card selection and manipulation, ensuring consistency in executing the combo.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using Eldrazi Temple and Ancient Tomb to play powerful Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Glaring Fleshraker. Utilizing cards like Kozilek's Command and Sowing Mycospawn to control the board while aggressively attacking the opponent. The deck also includes disruption elements like Wasteland and Cavern of Souls to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of cards like Once Upon a Time and Vexing Bauble help with card selection and ensuring a consistent mana base for the aggressive Eldrazi creatures to overwhelm the opponent.

The deck focuses on quickly getting out powerful creatures or enchantments such as Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Omniscience using cards like Show and Tell and Sneak Attack. By using cards like Simian Spirit Guide and Lotus Petal to generate quick mana, the player aims to overwhelm their opponent with big threats early in the game. With a mix of counterspells like Force of Will and disruption like Flusterstorm, the deck aims to protect its combo pieces and win the game with its powerful plays.

This deck focuses on using creatures like Nadu, Winged Wisdom and Nomads en-Kor to quickly assemble a combo that can win the game in a single turn. By tutoring for key pieces with Green Sun's Zenith and Chord of Calling, and ramping with Gaea's Cradle and Noble Hierarch, the deck aims to create a large board presence and overwhelm the opponent with a massive creature like Craterhoof Behemoth or Emrakul, the Aeons Torn. With protection from cards like Endurance and Sylvan Safekeeper, the deck can easily disrupt opponents' strategies and secure a victory.
